alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following county, Mendocino. * WHEN...Until 400 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ukiah, Ukiah Municipal Airport, Hopland, Talmage, Calpella and Redwood Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
